io.sphere.client.filters

Interface UserInputFilter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the user-entered value.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Filter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Filters.Fulltext, Filters.NumberAttribute.Range, Filters.NumberAttribute.SingleValue, Filters.Price.DynamicRange, Filters.Price.Range, Filters.Price.SingleValue, Filters.StringAttribute.SingleValue, UserInputAttributeFilterBase, UserInputFilterBase

    public interface UserInputFilter<T>
extends Filter
    Filter 'component' that supports a single user entered 'value' (such as price range) and keeping the state entered value in application's query string. See also: MultiSelectFilter.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getClearLink(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> queryString)
      Removes this filter from application's URL.
      boolean isSet(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> queryString)
      Returns true if the user entered a value for this filter (passed in application's URL).
      T parseValue(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> queryString)
      Returns the value that the user entered for this filter (passed in application's URL).

      • Methods inherited from interface io.sphere.client.filters.Filter

        parse, setQueryParam
